result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Nathan M. Plouff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
AODA assessment and follow-through
Comply with bail conditions
Sign all necessary releases to allow DA's office to monitor

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan M. Plouff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nathan M. Plouff not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement that Attorney Cirilli has provided documentation and defendant is in compliance. State moves to dismiss - Granted.

3:44 p.m. Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pfeifer statement that defendant has not completed counseling. Requests new review date - Court extends DEJ. Bail continued. Adj. 3:45 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

1:18 p.m. Defendant Nathan M. Plouff in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. State moves to amend Count 2 to 1st offense possession, a violation of 961.41(3g)(3) - Granted. Plea questionaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Count 2. Court finds that a factual basis for plea exists, accepts plea, defers entry of judgment and accepts deferred agreement on Count 1. Schiek/Cirilli/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
Fine - $300 plus costs ($914.50)
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 1:28 p.m. 
  Review hearing scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:39 p.m. Defendant Nathan M. Plouff in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek - close to resolution - Cirilli statement to DEJ -needs to be drafted. Bail continued. Adj. 2:41 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

11:29 am. Defendant Nathan M. Plouff in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirilli -close to resolution. Adj. 11:30 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:02 p.m. Defendant Nathan M. Plouff in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of Complaint - waive reading - enter not guilty plea. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand - includes cover letter

3:11 Defendant Nathan Plouff in court with attorney Gary Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also calling 15cf225 - St V Amanda Plouff - in court with Atty Jennifer Stuber for Timothy Melms = 
  Defendants waive preliminary hearings. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Bail continued on both cases -  Arraignment scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:23 pm. Defendant Nathan M. Plouff in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

1:53 p.m. Defendant Nathan M. Plouff in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be provided, right to counsel - defendant will be retaining Gary Cirilli,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $5000 sig  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
